text: Stadionul Viitorul is a multi-purpose stadium in Ovidiu, Romania. It is currently used mostly for football matches and is the home ground of Viitorul Constanța. The stadium holds 4,554 people. ==Events== === Association football === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: left;font-size:100%;" |- !colspan=6|International football matches |- !Date!!Competition!!Home!!Away!!Score!!Attendance |- |- |5 September 2017 |2019 UEFA Euro U-21 qualification | Romania | Switzerland |1 - 1 |1,621 |- |10 November 2017 |2019 UEFA Euro U-21 qualification | Romania | Portugal |1 - 1 |2,553 |} === Association football === {| class="wikitable collapsible collapsed" style="text-align: left;font-size:100%;" |- !colspan=6|International football clubs matches |- !Date!!Competition!!Home!!Away!!Score!!Attendance |- |5 September 2015 |Friendly | Viitorul | Cherno More Varna |0 - 2 | |- |21 October 2015 |UEFA Youth League | Viitorul | Minsk |5 - 1 |924 |- |25 November 2015 |UEFA Youth League | Viitorul | Příbram |0 - 0 |200 |- |4 August 2016 |UEFA Europa League | Viitorul | Gent |0 - 0 |1,294 |- |28 September 2016 |UEFA Youth League | Viitorul | Sheriff Tiraspol |4 - 1 |270 |- |2 November 2016 |UEFA Youth League | Viitorul | Zürich |5 - 0 |500 |- |8 February 2017 |UEFA Youth League | Viitorul | Copenhagen |4 - 2 |200 |- |26 July 2017 |UEFA Champions League | Viitorul | APOEL |1 - 0 |3,873 |- |17 August 2017 |UEFA Europa League | Viitorul | Salzburg |1 - 3 |3,338 |} ==References== Category:Ovidiu Category:Football venues in Romania Category:Buildings and structures in Constanța County Category:Multi-purpose stadiums in Romania
